description: Let's do a quick recap. We have added a property to indicate we are ready to fire. We have set it to true when the component is fully loaded.
Now let's create a new function, called _fire, in which we fire the rock! Firing the rock in our case will be the following line: "console.log('Fire away!!')".
Note that this function is also not static and should check whether the "_readyToFire" property is true.
Add the "_fire" function below the ready function and call it from the ready function afterwards. You'll need to go via "this" again. Good luck!
followUpMessage: You did it! You're able to fire your rock! Awesome!

exercises.template:
<link rel="import" href="lib/polymer/polymer-element.html">
<link rel="import" href="leather-pouch.html">
<link rel="import" href="rubber-strip.html">
<link rel="import" href="handle.html">
<link rel="import" href="rock.html">

<dom-module id="slingshot">
    <template>
        <rock></rock>
        <leather-pouch></leather-pouch>
        <rubber-strip side="[[_leftSide]]"></rubber-strip>
        <rubber-strip side="[[_rightSide]]"></rubber-strip>
        <handle></handle>
    </template>
</dom-module>

<script>
    class Slingshot extends Polymer.Element {

        static get is() {
            return 'slingshot';
        }

        static get properties() {
            return {
                _leftSide: {
                    type: String,
                    value: 'Left',
                },
                _rightSide: {
                    type: String,
                    value: 'Right',
                },
                _readyToFire: {
                    type: Boolean,
                    value: false,
                },
            };
        }

        ready() {
            super.ready();

            this._readyToFire = true;
        }
    }

    window.customElements.define(Slingshot.is, Slingshot);
</script>
exercises.hint:
<link rel="import" href="lib/polymer/polymer-element.html">
<link rel="import" href="leather-pouch.html">
<link rel="import" href="rubber-strip.html">
<link rel="import" href="handle.html">
<link rel="import" href="rock.html">

<dom-module id="slingshot">
    <template>
        <rock></rock>
        <leather-pouch></leather-pouch>
        <rubber-strip side="[[_leftSide]]"></rubber-strip>
        <rubber-strip side="[[_rightSide]]"></rubber-strip>
        <handle></handle>
    </template>
</dom-module>

<script>
    class Slingshot extends Polymer.Element {

        static get is() {
            return 'slingshot';
        }

        static get properties() {
            return {
                _leftSide: {
                    type: String,
                    value: 'Left',
                },
                _rightSide: {
                    type: String,
                    value: 'Right',
                },
                _readyToFire: {
                    type: Boolean,
                    value: false,
                },
            };
        }

        ready() {
            super.ready();

            this._readyToFire = true;
            this._fire();
        }

        _fire() {
            if(this._readyToFire) {
                console.log('Fire away!!');
            }
        }
    }

    window.customElements.define(Slingshot.is, Slingshot);
</script>
